turn.2: Oskar Øksnes Oskar Øksnes (11 April 1921 – 27 March 1999) was a Norwegian politician for the Labour Party.
turn.4: He was born in Kvam, Nord-Trøndelag.
turn.5: What did he do for the ministry?
turn.6: An agronomist by education, Øksnes was state secretary to the Minister of Agriculture from 1964 to 1965, during the Gerhardsen's Fourth Cabinet.
turn.7: What else did you find interesting about him?
turn.8: He later became the Minister of Agriculture in 1976–1981 in Nordli's Cabinet and in 1981 in Brundtland's First Cabinet.
turn.9: Was he ever awarded with anything?
